title: Trusting Through the Waves
sub_title: The Wisdom of the Boat Builder
devotional:
Old Man Hemlock sat on the porch, whittling a piece of wood into what might someday resemble a bird. The July sun beat down, and the air shimmered with heat, making the cicadas buzz louder than usual. A young boy, barely ten, shuffled up the steps, kicking a stone ahead of him. 'Mr. Hemlock,' he said, his voice laced with a mix of awe and frustration, 'How do you always seem so calm? Nothing ever seems to bother you.'

Hemlock chuckled, a low rumble in his chest. He set down his whittling and gestured for the boy to sit beside him. 'Calm ain't about never havin' storms, son. It's about trustin' the boat builder when the waves get high.'

The boy frowned, confused. 'Boat builder?'

'Aye,' Hemlock said, pointing up at the sky. 'The One who made it all. The One who knows the sea better than the fish. Life's gonna throw waves at you, some small ripples, others tsunamis. You can't stop the waves, but you can trust that the Boat Builder knows what He's doin'.'

He picked up his piece of wood again. 'I used to fret over every little thing. Every bill, every disappointment, every fear. But then I realized I was spendin' all my energy fightin' the waves instead of trustin' the One who commands them. Now, I still feel the fear, the worry, the sadness, but I don't let it drown me. I cling to the promise that He's got me, that He'll see me through. It's not always easy, mind you. Some days, the waves feel like they're gonna swallow me whole. But I remember the Boat Builder, and I hold on.'

He looked at the boy, his eyes crinkling at the corners. 'So, what waves are you fightin' today, son?'

The boy hesitated, then told Hemlock about a looming test at school he felt unprepared for. Hemlock listened patiently, then simply said, 'Study hard, do your best, and then... trust. Trust that whatever happens, you'll learn somethin' valuable. The Boat Builder doesn't always give us the outcome we want, but He always gives us what we need.'

The boy nodded, a new light in his eyes. The sun still beat down, the cicadas still buzzed, but the waves inside him seemed a little calmer.
image_description: A weathered wooden porch with a rocking chair and tools for whittling under a clear blue sky with the sun shining
insights: Old Man Hemlock's wisdom echoes the core message of Proverbs 3:5-6: 'Trust in the Lord with all your heart and lean not on your own understanding; in all your ways submit to him, and he will make your paths straight.' This isn't a passive trust, but an active surrender of our worries and plans to God's will. It acknowledges that our understanding is limited, and that God's perspective is infinitely greater. This also resonates with Jesus' words in Matthew 6:34, 'Therefore do not worry about tomorrow, for tomorrow will worry about itself. Each day has enough trouble of its own,' reinforcing the importance of focusing on trusting God in the present moment rather than being consumed by anxieties about the future.
prayer: Heavenly Father, I confess that I often struggle with trust. I try to control every aspect of my life, and I fear the unknown. Help me to release my grip on my own plans and to surrender to Your will. Remind me that You are the Boat Builder, and that You are always with me, even when the waves are high. Grant me the peace that surpasses all understanding, and fill me with the courage to face whatever challenges lie ahead. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: What are the 'waves' you are currently facing in your life? Where do you find it most difficult to trust God? What practical steps can you take this week to strengthen your trust in Him?
